intro: Spuriopimpinella ionantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Spuriopimpinella ionantha is often found in open meadows and along coastal bluffs.
